author: Special Correspondent
text:
Allocation for higher and school education in the Union Budget has evoked a mixed response from sections of the academia.

According to Prince Gajendra Babu, general secretary of State Platform for Common School System, by not allocating funds to the University Grants Commission, the government had cleared the ground for the General Agreement on Trade in Services (GATS) to come into force. Thangam Meghanathan, chairperson of Rajalakshmi group of institutions and S. Vaidyasubramanian, dean, SASTRA University welcomed the allocation of Rs. 1,700 crore for multi-skilling human resources and introduction of massive open online courses.

Govt. had cleared the ground for General Agreement on Trade in Services to come into force
title: Opinion divided on funds for school education
